# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to", "domain": "legal", "dataset": "document_knowledge_qa_raft_p0.4"}

messages.content:
Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

Question: क्या कोई पुरुष उस महिला के खिलाफ कानूनी कार्रवाई कर सकता है जिसने उसे अपमानित करने के लिए बहस के दौरान उसका दुपट्टा फाड़ दिया, क्योंकि यह भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133 के तहत आता है?

Answer: हां, किसी को अपमानित करने के लिए बल का उपयोग करना धारा 133 के तहत एक आपराधिक अपराध है। इस परिदृश्य में, महिला ने जानबूझकर उसे अपमानित करने के लिए पुरुष का दुपट्टा फाड़ दिया, जो अपराध की कानूनी परिभाषा के साथ संरेखित है। इसलिए, पुरुष को उसके खिलाफ कानूनी कार्रवाई करने का अधिकार है।

{"sdg_document": "# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to", "domain": "legal", "dataset": "document_knowledge_qa_raft_p0.4"}

messages.content:
Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

Question: क्या कोई पुरुष कानूनी कार्रवाई कर सकता है यदि कोई महिला झगड़े के दौरान उसे अपमानित करने के लिए उसका दुपट्टा फाड़ देती है, जैसा कि उसे करने के लिए मजबूर किया गया था?
Answer: हां, यह धारा 133 के अंतर्गत आता है, क्योंकि बल का उपयोग अपमान के इरादे से किया गया था।

Question: क्या कोई पत्रकार कानूनी कार्रवाई कर सकता है यदि कोई व्यक्ति उन पर स्याही फेंककर उन्हें शर्मिंदा या अपमानित करता है?

Answer: हां, भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133 के तहत किसी को अपमानित करने के लिए आपराधिक बल का उपयोग करना एक आपराधिक अपराध है। इस मामले में, जानबूझकर एक पत्रकार पर उन्हें अपमानित करने के इरादे से स्याही फेंकने की अनुमति देना आपराधिक बल का कार्य माना जाएगा, और पत्रकार अपराधी के खिलाफ कानूनी कार्रवाई कर सकता है।

इस सजा में तीन महीने तक की कैद या एक हजार रुपये तक का जुर्माना या दोनों शामिल हैं।

{"sdg_document": "# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to", "domain": "legal", "dataset": "document_knowledge_qa_raft_p0.4"}

messages.content:
Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

Question: क्या चोरी को रोकने के लिए किसी को धक्का देने के लिए भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत किसी व्यक्ति पर आरोप लगाया जा सकता है, भले ही धक्का दिया गया व्यक्ति प्रतिरोध कर रहा हो?

Answer: हां, किसी व्यक्ति पर किसी अपराध के दौरान आपराधिक बल प्रयोग करने के लिए धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है। इस मामले में, यदि धक्का दिया गया व्यक्ति चोरी का विरोध कर रहा था, तो भी बल का प्रयोग आपराधिक बल माना जा सकता है।

Question: क्या किसी लुटेरे पर धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है, यदि उसने दुकानदार को दबाने के लिए बल का प्रयोग किया हो, लेकिन चोरी करने में सफल नहीं हुआ हो?

Answer: नहीं, इस परिदृश्य में डकैत पर धारा 134 का आरोप नहीं लगाया जा सकता है। जबकि डकैत ने बल का इस्तेमाल किया, बल का उपयोग चोरी के अपराध के संबंध में किसी भी व्यक्ति के प्रति निर्देशित नहीं था। धारा 134 तब लागू होती है जब कोई व्यक्ति चोरी करने के प्रयास में किसी अन्य व्यक्ति पर बल का उपयोग करता है। इस मामले में, दुकानदार ने विरोध किया लेकिन डकैती का शिकार नहीं हुआ, इसलिए डकैत ने चोरी के अपराध के संबंध में दुकानदार पर बल का उपयोग नहीं किया।

भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 132 में वर्णित अपने कर्तव्यों का निर्वहन करते हुए किसी लोक सेवक पर आपराधिक बल प्रयोग करने की क्या सजा है?

इस धारा में कहा गया है कि जो व्यक्ति अपने कर्तव्य के निर्वहन में किसी लोक सेवक पर आपराधिक बल प्रयोग करता है या उसका उपयोग करता है, जिसका उद्देश्य उसे अपने कर्तव्य का निर्वहन करने से रोकना या उसे रोकने का है, या जो कुछ भी लोक सेवक ने अपने कर्तव्य के वैध निर्वहन में किया है या करने का प्रयास किया है, उसके परिणामस्वरूप, उसे दो वर्ष तक की कैद या जुर्माने या दोनों के साथ दंडित किया जाएगा।

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

Question: क्या किसी व्यक्ति पर भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है यदि वह किसी अन्य व्यक्ति द्वारा अपहरण किए जाने का विरोध करने के लिए बल का प्रयोग करता है?

Answer: हाँ, किसी व्यक्ति पर भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है यदि वह किसी अन्य व्यक्ति द्वारा छीनने का विरोध करने के लिए बल का उपयोग करता है। ऐसा इसलिए है क्योंकि धारा 134 बल का उपयोग करके चोरी करने के किसी भी प्रयास को कवर करती है, भले ही चोरी स्वयं सफल हो। इस परिदृश्य में, जबरन छीनने का विरोध करने के लिए बल का उपयोग चोरी करने के प्रयास के रूप में माना जाएगा, जिससे यह धारा 134 के तहत एक आपराधिक अपराध बन जाएगा।

Question: क्या किसी को भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत बल प्रयोग करके प्रतिरोध करने वाले डिलिवरी व्यक्ति पर हमला करने का आरोप लगाया जा सकता है?

Answer: हाँ, वे कर सकते हैं। धारा 134 के अनुसार, अपने कर्तव्य के निष्पादन में या उन्हें अपने कर्तव्य को निर्वहन करने से रोकने के इरादे से एक लोक सेवक पर आपराधिक बल का उपयोग करना एक आपराधिक अपराध है। इस मामले में, डिलीवरी व्यक्ति को बल के साथ प्रतिरोध किया गया था, जिसे डिलीवरी व्यक्ति को अपने कर्तव्य को निभाने से रोकने के प्रयास के रूप में व्याख्या किया जा सकता है। इसलिए, जिस व्यक्ति ने डिलीवरी व्यक्ति पर हमला किया, उस पर भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है।

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

Question: क्या भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत किसी व्यक्ति पर चोरी का आरोप लगाया जा सकता है यदि वह किसी का हैंडबैग छीन ले और प्रतिरोध करते हुए उसे धक्का दे?

Answer: हां, उस व्यक्ति पर भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत चोरी का आरोप लगाया जा सकता है। इस धारा में अपराध के दौरान किसी व्यक्ति पर बल प्रयोग करके की गई चोरी का अपराध शामिल है। इस परिदृश्य में, उस व्यक्ति ने हाथ का बैग छीनने और महिला को धक्का देने के लिए बल का इस्तेमाल किया, जो धारा 134 में उल्लिखित मानदंडों के अनुरूप है।

Question: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 132 के अंतर्गत लोक सेवक कौन है?

Answer: कोई व्यक्ति जो ऐसे लोक सेवक के रूप में अपने कर्तव्य के निष्पादन में लोक सेवक है, या ऐसे लोक सेवक के रूप में अपने कर्तव्य के निर्वहन से उस व्यक्ति को रोकने या रोकने के इरादे से, या ऐसे व्यक्ति द्वारा अपने कर्तव्य के वैध निर्वहन में किए गए या किए जाने के प्रयास के परिणामस्वरूप।

Question: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 132 में उल्लिखित किसी लोक सेवक को अपने कर्तव्य का निर्वहन करने से रोकने के लिए बल का प्रयोग करने का कानूनी परिणाम क्या है?

Answer: जो कोई ऐसे लोक सेवक के रूप में अपने कर्तव्य के निर्वहन में किसी लोक सेवक होने वाले व्यक्ति पर हमला करता है या आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करता है, या ऐसे लोक सेवक के रूप में अपने कर्तव्य के निर्वहन से उस व्यक्ति को रोकने या रोकने के इरादे से, या ऐसे व्यक्ति द्वारा अपने कर्तव्य के वैध निर्वहन में किए गए किसी कार्य के परिणामस्वरूप, या करने का प्रयास करता है, उसे दो वर्ष तक की अवधि के लिए किसी भी वर्णनात्मक कैद या जुर्माने या दोनों के साथ दंडित किया जाएगा।

{"sdg_document": "# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to", "domain": "legal", "dataset": "document_knowledge_qa_raft_p0.4"}

messages.content:
Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to


Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

Question: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133 के अनुसार किसी व्यक्ति को अपमानित करने के इरादे से हमला करने का कानूनी परिणाम क्या है?

Answer: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133 के अनुसार, जो कोई भी किसी व्यक्ति को उकसाने, अपमानित करने, डराने या अपमानित करने के इरादे से किसी व्यक्ति पर हमला करता है या आपराधिक बल का उपयोग करता है, उसे एक वर्ष तक की अवधि के लिए किसी भी विवरण की कैद या जुर्माने या दोनों के साथ दंडित किया जाएगा।

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

Question: क्या आप भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 132 में उल्लिखित अपने कर्तव्यों का पालन करते हुए लोक सेवक पर आपराधिक बल प्रयोग करने के कानूनी परिणामों की व्याख्या कर सकते हैं?

Answer: धारा 132 के अनुसार, यदि कोई व्यक्ति किसी लोक सेवक पर जब वह अपना कर्तव्य निभा रहा हो या उसे ऐसा करने से रोकने या रोकने के इरादे से हमला करता है या आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करता है, तो उसे दो वर्ष तक की कैद, जुर्माना या दोनों के साथ दंडित किया जा सकता है।

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना के लिए कौन जिम्मेदार है?

इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना गवर्नेंस का प्रबंधन व्यक्तियों और संगठनों की एक टीम द्वारा किया जाता है, जिसमें इंस्ट्रक्टलैब फाउंडेशन, इंस्ट्रक्टलैब एडवाइजरी बोर्ड और इंस्ट्रक्टलैब टेक्निकल कमेटी शामिल हैं। इन संस्थाओं की विशिष्ट भूमिकाओं और जिम्मेदारियों को इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस दस्तावेज़ में उल्लिखित किया गया है, जो आधिकारिक इंस्ट्रक्टलैब वेबसाइट पर पाया जा सकता है।

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के शासन में गृह मंत्रालय की क्या भूमिका है?

गृह मंत्रालय (एमएचए) इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के शासन में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाता है, जो एक ऑनलाइन प्लेटफॉर्म है जो शैक्षिक संसाधन प्रदान करता है। भारतीय दंड संहिता (आईपीसी) में उल्लिखित आपराधिक बल से संबंधित कानूनों और विनियमों के कार्यान्वयन की देखरेख करने के लिए एमएचए जिम्मेदार है। इस संदर्भ में, एमएचए यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि इंस्ट्रक्टलैब आईपीसी के प्रावधानों का पालन करता है, विशेष रूप से हमले या आपराधिक बल से संबंधित, सभी उपयोगकर्ताओं के लिए एक सुरक्षित और सम्मानजनक सीखने के माहौल को बनाए रखने के लिए।

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के विकास और संचालन की देखरेख में इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना शासन की क्या भूमिका है?

इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना शासन यह सुनिश्चित करने के लिए जिम्मेदार है कि इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना को इसके मिशन, दृष्टि और मूल्यों के अनुसार विकसित और संचालित किया जाए। इसमें रणनीतिक दिशा निर्धारित करना, परियोजना के भविष्य के बारे में महत्वपूर्ण निर्णय लेना और इसकी योजनाओं और लक्ष्यों के कार्यान्वयन की देखरेख करना शामिल है। शासन संरचना हितधारकों को परियोजना के साथ जुड़ने और इसके विकास और संचालन पर इनपुट प्रदान करने के लिए एक तंत्र प्रदान करती है।

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to



# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना शासन का उद्देश्य क्या है?

इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के शासन का उद्देश्य परियोजना की स्थिरता, पारदर्शिता और जवाबदेही सुनिश्चित करना है। यह निर्णय लेने, संसाधन आवंटन और हितधारक सगाई के लिए नीतियों, प्रक्रियाओं और दिशानिर्देशों को स्थापित करता है।

metadata:
{"sdg_document": "dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना शासन इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना के प्रबंधन और दिशा की देखरेख के लिए जिम्मेदार है, यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि यह अपने मिशन और मूल्यों के साथ संरेखित हो, और यह अपने लक्ष्यों और उद्देश्यों को पूरा करता है। इसमें नीतियां और प्रक्रियाएं स्थापित करना, रणनीतिक निर्णय लेना और प्रासंगिक कानूनों और विनियमों के अनुपालन को सुनिश्चित करना शामिल है। शासन संरचना में निदेशक मंडल, सलाहकार समितियां या अन्य शासी निकाय, साथ ही कर्मचारी और स्वयंसेवक शामिल हो सकते हैं जो परियोजना की सफलता में योगदान देते हैं।

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to



आपराधिक बल के संबंध में भारतीय दंड संहिता का उद्देश्य क्या है?

भारतीय दंड संहिता में आपराधिक बल से संबंधित विभिन्न कानूनी प्रावधानों की रूपरेखा दी गई है, वास्तविक दुनिया के परिदृश्यों के माध्यम से प्रासंगिक विधियों की व्याख्या की गई है और इसका उद्देश्य व्यक्तियों को उनके अधिकारों और गैरकानूनी रूप से बल के उपयोग के कानूनी परिणामों के बारे में शिक्षित करना है।

{"sdg_document": "dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: दस्तावेज़ में "इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस" अनुभाग का उद्देश्य क्या है?

दस्तावेज़ में "इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस" अनुभाग में यह जानकारी प्रदान करता है कि इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना कैसे शासित और प्रबंधित की जाती है। यह निदेशक मंडल, परियोजना प्रबंधकों और समुदाय के सदस्यों सहित विभिन्न हितधारकों की भूमिकाओं और जिम्मेदारियों की रूपरेखा तैयार करता है। इस अनुभाग का उद्देश्य इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना के शासन संरचना में पारदर्शिता और जवाबदेही सुनिश्चित करना और निर्णय लेने और संघर्ष समाधान के लिए स्पष्ट दिशानिर्देश प्रदान करना है।

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: भारतीय दंड संहिता में गृह मंत्रालय की क्या भूमिका है?

गृह मंत्रालय (एमएचए) भारतीय दंड संहिता (आईपीसी) के प्रशासन और प्रवर्तन के लिए जिम्मेदार है, जो दस्तावेज में उल्लिखित आपराधिक बल से संबंधित विभिन्न कानूनी प्रावधानों की रूपरेखा तैयार करता है। एमएचए यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि आईपीसी पूरे भारत में समान रूप से लागू किया जाए और सभी कानून प्रवर्तन एजेंसियां इसके दिशानिर्देशों और नियमों का पालन करें। इसके अतिरिक्त, एमएचए आईपीसी की व्याख्या और आवेदन के संबंध में राज्य सरकारों और कानून प्रवर्तन अधिकारियों को निर्देश या निर्देश जारी कर सकता है।

Document:
# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to


Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

Question: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133, 134 और 135 का उद्देश्य क्या है?

Answer: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133, 134 और 135 विभिन्न संदर्भों में आपराधिक बल या हमले के उपयोग से संबंधित है, जैसे कि किसी अन्य व्यक्ति का अपमान करना या अपमान करना, चोरी करने का प्रयास करना और किसी को गलत तरीके से कैद करना। इन धाराओं का उद्देश्य व्यक्तियों के अधिकारों की रक्षा करना और बल के अवैध उपयोग के कानूनी परिणामों की रूपरेखा तैयार करके सामाजिक व्यवस्था बनाए रखना है।

# **Indian Penal Code: Sections on Assault and Criminal Force**

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to


Document:
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: भारतीय दंड संहिता में गृह मंत्रालय की क्या भूमिका है?

गृह मंत्रालय (एमएचए) भारतीय दंड संहिता (आईपीसी) के प्रशासन और प्रवर्तन के लिए जिम्मेदार है, जो दस्तावेज में उल्लिखित आपराधिक बल से संबंधित विभिन्न कानूनी प्रावधानों की रूपरेखा तैयार करता है। गृह मंत्रालय यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि आईपीसी पूरे देश में प्रभावी ढंग से लागू और लागू किया जाए, और यह अपराध और सजा से संबंधित कानूनों और विनियमों को विकसित करने और अद्यतन करने में भी भूमिका निभाता है।

भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 135, 136 और 137 का उद्देश्य क्या है?

ये धाराएं हमले या आपराधिक बल से संबंधित कानूनी प्रावधानों की रूपरेखा तैयार करती हैं, वास्तविक दुनिया के परिदृश्यों के माध्यम से प्रासंगिक क़ानूनों की व्याख्या करती हैं और इसका उद्देश्य व्यक्तियों को उनके अधिकारों और गैरकानूनी रूप से बल के उपयोग के कानूनी परिणामों के बारे में शिक्षित करना है। विशेष रूप से: - धारा 135 एक व्यक्ति को गलत तरीके से कैद करने के प्रयास में हमले या आपराधिक बल से संबंधित है, जिसमें एक वर्ष तक की कैद और / या पांच हजार रुपये तक का जुर्माना शामिल है। - धारा 136 गंभीर और अचानक उकसावे पर हमले या आपराधिक बल को संबोधित करती है, जिसके परिणामस्वरूप एक महीने तक की साधारण कैद और / या एक हजार रुपये तक का जुर्माना होता है। - धारा 137 अपमानजनक अपराध को कवर करती है, जिसमें दो साल तक की कैद और / या जुर्माना शामिल है।

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के शासन में गृह मंत्रालय की क्या भूमिका है?

गृह मंत्रालय भारतीय दंड संहिता के कार्यान्वयन और प्रवर्तन की देखरेख के लिए जिम्मेदार है, जिसमें धारा 134, 135 और 136 में उल्लिखित आपराधिक बल से संबंधित प्रावधान शामिल हैं। इंस्ट्रक्टलैब द्वारा शासित एक परियोजना के रूप में, गृह मंत्रालय यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि मंच की नीतियां और दिशानिर्देश इन धाराओं द्वारा स्थापित कानूनी ढांचे के अनुरूप हों।

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to", "domain": "legal", "dataset": "document_knowledge_qa"}

Answer: हां, किसी व्यक्ति पर किसी अपराध के दौरान आपराधिक बल प्रयोग करने के लिए धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है। इस मामले में, यदि धक्का दिया गया व्यक्ति चोरी का विरोध कर रहा था, तो भी बल का प्रयोग आपराधिक बल माना जा सकता है।

Answer: हाँ, वे कर सकते हैं। धारा 134 के अनुसार, अपने कर्तव्य के निष्पादन में या उन्हें अपने कर्तव्य को निर्वहन करने से रोकने के इरादे से एक लोक सेवक पर आपराधिक बल का उपयोग करना एक आपराधिक अपराध है। इस मामले में, डिलीवरी व्यक्ति को बल के साथ प्रतिरोध किया गया था, जिसे डिलीवरी व्यक्ति को अपने कर्तव्य को निभाने से रोकने के प्रयास के रूप में व्याख्या किया जा सकता है। इसलिए, जिस व्यक्ति ने डिलीवरी व्यक्ति पर हमला किया, उस पर भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 134 के तहत आरोप लगाया जा सकता है।

# Title: **Section 131: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force Otherwise Than on Grave Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to

one thousand rupees, or with both.

## **Explanation 1:**

Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment for an offence under this section:

- (a) If the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence.  

- (b) If the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant, in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant.  

- (c) If the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.  

## **Explanation 2:**

Whether the provocation was grave and sudden enough to mitigate the offence is a question of fact.

## **Section 132: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter Public Servant from Discharge of Duty**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in

the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that

person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything

done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty, shall be

punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years,

or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 133: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonour a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to

Question: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 132 के अंतर्गत लोक सेवक कौन है?

Answer: कोई व्यक्ति जो ऐसे लोक सेवक के रूप में अपने कर्तव्य के निष्पादन में लोक सेवक है, या ऐसे लोक सेवक के रूप में अपने कर्तव्य के निर्वहन से उस व्यक्ति को रोकने या रोकने के इरादे से, या ऐसे व्यक्ति द्वारा अपने कर्तव्य के वैध निर्वहन में किए गए या किए जाने के प्रयास के परिणामस्वरूप।

and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either

messages.content:
<|start_of_role|>user<|end_of_role|>
dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के शासन में गृह मंत्रालय की क्या भूमिका है?
<|start_of_role|>assistant<|end_of_role|>
गृह मंत्रालय (एमएचए) इंस्ट्रक्टलैब के शासन में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाता है, जो एक ऑनलाइन प्लेटफॉर्म है जो शैक्षिक संसाधन प्रदान करता है। भारतीय दंड संहिता (आईपीसी) में उल्लिखित आपराधिक बल से संबंधित कानूनों और विनियमों के कार्यान्वयन की देखरेख करने के लिए एमएचए जिम्मेदार है। इस संदर्भ में, एमएचए यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि इंस्ट्रक्टलैब आईपीसी के प्रावधानों का पालन करता है, विशेष रूप से हमले या आपराधिक बल से संबंधित, सभी उपयोगकर्ताओं के लिए एक सुरक्षित और सम्मानजनक सीखने के माहौल को बनाए रखने के लिए।

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

<|start_of_role|>assistant<|end_of_role|>
इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना शासन यह सुनिश्चित करने के लिए जिम्मेदार है कि इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना को इसके मिशन, दृष्टि और मूल्यों के अनुसार विकसित और संचालित किया जाए। इसमें रणनीतिक दिशा निर्धारित करना, परियोजना के भविष्य के बारे में महत्वपूर्ण निर्णय लेना और इसकी योजनाओं और लक्ष्यों के कार्यान्वयन की देखरेख करना शामिल है। शासन संरचना हितधारकों को परियोजना के साथ जुड़ने और इसके विकास और संचालन पर इनपुट प्रदान करने के लिए एक तंत्र प्रदान करती है।

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना के लिए कौन जिम्मेदार है?
<|start_of_role|>assistant<|end_of_role|>
इंस्ट्रक्टलैब परियोजना शासन का प्रबंधन व्यक्तियों की एक टीम द्वारा किया जाता है, जिसमें परियोजना का नेतृत्व, तकनीकी नेतृत्व और सामुदायिक प्रबंधक शामिल हैं। परियोजना का नेतृत्व समग्र रणनीति और दिशा के लिए जिम्मेदार है, जबकि तकनीकी नेतृत्व विकास के विशिष्ट क्षेत्रों की देखरेख करता है। सामुदायिक प्रबंधक परियोजना के उपयोगकर्ता आधार के साथ संचार और जुड़ाव की सुविधा प्रदान करते हैं।

metadata:
{"sdg_document": "dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that

person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may

extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

## **Section 134: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft of Property Carried by a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit

theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with

imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine,

or with both.

## **Section 135: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

<|start_of_role|>assistant<|end_of_role|>

# इंस्ट्रक्टलैब गवर्नेंस: भारतीय दंड संहिता में गृह मंत्रालय की क्या भूमिका है?
<|start_of_role|>assistant<|end_of_role|>
गृह मंत्रालय (एमएचए) भारतीय दंड संहिता (आईपीसी) के प्रशासन और प्रवर्तन के लिए जिम्मेदार है, जो दस्तावेज में उल्लिखित आपराधिक बल से संबंधित विभिन्न कानूनी प्रावधानों की रूपरेखा तैयार करता है। एमएचए यह सुनिश्चित करता है कि आईपीसी पूरे भारत में समान रूप से लागू किया जाए और सभी कानून प्रवर्तन एजेंसियां इसके दिशानिर्देशों और नियमों का पालन करें। इसके अतिरिक्त, एमएचए आईपीसी की व्याख्या और आवेदन के संबंध में राज्य सरकारों और कानून प्रवर्तन अधिकारियों को निर्देश या निर्देश जारी कर सकता है।

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code

to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a

term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five thousand

rupees, or with both.

## **Section 136: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave and Sudden Provocation**

Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden

provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a

term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one thousand

rupees, or with both.

For more details, refer to the official document:

Ministry of Home Affairs – Indian Penal Code
